title: Apple's requirements are about to hit creators and fans on Patreon
dot: digraph PatreonAppleChanges{node[shape=box, style="rounded,filled", fillcolor="#f9f9f9"]; A[label="Apple's Requirements Impacting Patreon" shape=ellipse, fillcolor="#ffcc00"]; B1[label="Apple requires Patreon to use iOS in-app purchase system\nby November 2024" fillcolor="#e0e0e0"];B2[label="Consequences for Creators" fillcolor="#e0e0e0"];B3[label="Navigating Apple’s Fee" fillcolor="#e0e0e0"];B4[label="Navigating Apple’s Billing Requirement" fillcolor="#e0e0e0"]; C1[label="30% App Store fee on new memberships in iOS app" fillcolor="#ffffff"];C2[label="Switch to subscription billing required for iOS transactions" fillcolor="#ffffff"]; D1[label="Optional tool to increase prices in iOS app" fillcolor="#ffffff"];D2[label="Choice to keep prices the same and absorb fee" fillcolor="#ffffff"]; E1[label="Migration to subscription billing for all creators by November 2025" fillcolor="#ffffff"];E2[label="Support for creators migrating from first-of-the-month and per-creation billing" fillcolor="#ffffff"]; A->B1;A->B2;A->B3;A->B4; B2->C1;B2->C2; B3->D1;B3->D2; B4->E1;B4->E2;rankdir=TB;}

title: Blitz: A lightweight, modular, extensible web renderer
dot:
digraph Blitz{node[shape=box, style=filled, fillcolor=lightblue];Blitz[label="Blitz
A Radically Modular HTML/CSS Rendering Engine" shape=ellipse fillcolor=lightgreen];Status[label="Status
Pre-alpha state, capable renderer, many bugs, not recommended for production" shape=box];Goals[label="Goals
- Render HTML/CSS
- Support modern layouts
- Accessibility
- Extensibility" shape=box];Architecture[label="Architecture
Core DOM abstraction
Modular components
High-level wrappers" shape=box];Dependencies[label="Notable Dependencies
- Stylo
- Vello + WGPU
- Taffy
- AccessKit
- Winit" shape=box];Modules[label="1st-party Modules
- blitz-traits
- blitz-dom
- blitz-renderer-vello
- blitz-net
- blitz-html
- blitz-shell
- dioxus-native" shape=box];License[label="License
Dual licensed under Apache 2.0 and MIT" shape=box];Screenshot[label="Screenshot
Counter example" shape=box];Blitz->Status;Blitz->Goals;Blitz->Architecture;Architecture->Dependencies;Architecture->Modules;Blitz->License;Blitz->Screenshot;}

title: How to avoid losing items? Holding pens
dot: digraph G{node[shape=rect, style=filled, fillcolor=lightgray, fontname="Helvetica"];edge[fontname="Helvetica"];Q[label="Why do we lose things inside our homes?" shape=ellipse, fillcolor=lightyellow];P1[label="Items placed randomly due to interruptions, urgency, or fleeting states of mind"];P2[label="State of mind is fleeting; forget where things are placed"];S1[label="Assigned places for each item"];S2[label="Example: Keys always in designated spots (pocket, keychain, cubby)"];R1[label="Some items don’t have permanent places"];R2[label="Sometimes no time to return item to assigned place"];H1[label="Holding Pen (Temporary Storage)"];H2[label="Designated area in each room (tray with lip)"];H3[label="Tray size: 12\" x 18\", to fit most items"];H4[label="Located in every room for easy access"];H5[label="Used unless item goes to permanent location"];H6[label="Regular cleaning to prevent accumulation of items"];Q->P1->P2;P2->S1;S1->S2;P1->R1;P1->R2;S2->H1;H1->H2;H1->H3;H1->H4;H1->H5;H1->H6;rankdir=TB;nodesep=0.5;ranksep=0.75;}
